Evaluation_Questions: How well did this course, to the extent promised in the syllabus, enable “conversation across lines of difference,” integrate practical and theoretical concerns, or consider and integrate issues of class, gender/sexuality, race/ethnicity, dis/ability, and or global/cultural diversity
Comments_Questions: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your Teaching Fellow as an instructor and how might his/her teaching be improved
What was the name of your practicum instructor
What were her/his strengths or weaknesses
Comments_List: Evelyne is a great teach fellow. She is always ready to help her students and assists them with useful resources.
Evelyne was knowledgeable and helpful
In the few times I interacted with her, she was very approachable and positive. I was no in her section.

Evelyne did a wonderful job of teaching a group of people with varying backgrounds of interaction with (or not) the Old Testament. Discussion sections worked well with the lectures, and added useful material and practices. I appreciated that we got to practice the interpretive methods and exegesis in discussion, since class meetings were all lecture-based. Evelyne brought structure to discussion section meetings, but was flexible enough to answer questions that we had throughout. I especially appreciate her giving extra time for a review session before the midterm and another before the final exam. It was clear that Evelyne has a strong grounding in the class material, and beyond, and her teaching skill helped make discussion sections a very useful part of the semester.

I thought Evelyne was great. She is clearly brilliant, is excited about the material, and genuinely cares about student success and understanding of the material. I always came out of section feeling like I had a new tool at my disposal for exegesis.

She was very responsive, diligent and kind.  She tried hard to explain everything.  I don't have suggestions for improvement - she really added to the course and was faithful to each task she was assigned by Professor Wilson to complete in section.

Evelyne was incredible - she was really prepared for each session and available for any questions we might have. You can tell that she cares about her students and wanted them to fully grasp the material.
Teaching Fellow is John Thames; checkbox not available on this form

This wasn't my TFI don't now why it isn't giving me John Thames as an option, but he's amazing and Yale should hire him as a prof (I learned more from him than I did any of my PROFESSORS, and his relationship with us students made me excited to go to section. He works incredibly well with people, is incredibly knowledgeable, and is incredibly kind. Can you just hire him with tenure already?).
TJ was my Teaching Fellow that led sections. He did a great job fielding our questions, engaging us in conversation, and synthesizing our readings and lectures.
Thames was my teaching Fellow, and he did a excellent job.

AMAZING!!!
She was super helpful and organized.
Evelyne was responsive and communicative. She allayed our fears and anxieties as a group.
There were several moments when we weren't sure about what would be relevant. She steered us in the right direction.
She directly answered our questions and did research to make sure we understood.
Evelyne was great! She helped to make sense of the things many of us were confused about. She also ensured that we understand the matieral and effectively prepared us for testing.
Evelyne was amazingly available and helpful.  I felt as though she genuinely cared about her students and wanted to see all of them succeed in the course.

Outstanding!  Evelyne sent emails and maintained regular communication that showed a sincere, real interest.

I sat behind her or in the same row often in lecture and she followed along.  (Sometimes I see the TFs on the phone or doing something else but not Evelyne.)

She was not late to section nor unprepared.  Rather, Evelyne was engaged and dedicated to our learning.  This is a wonderful professionalism.

Her English is first-rate.  I admire how well she does in this second language.
Simply amazing. I learned so much from her.
Evelyne did a great job as our teaching fellow. She had a plan for out discussions, she was very knowledgeable, as well as incredibly accommodating for us students. She is an excellent teacher!
John Thames
John Thames
Very approachable, good teacher.
Knowledge and caring.
